author: bob (not bob
title: LOVE THIS APP!!!
content: Ok I love Spotify and I prefer it over Apple Music. BUT, I do have a few things that I think need improvement. I don't have Spotify premium and I'm not saying allow certain things that you allow in premium, but things that premium also doesn't include. First, I hate how you can't search for songs in your library(or in playlists). Next, I hate how you can't play all your songs at once, like you can in Apple Music. The only reason I know this is because my family has a plan on Apple Music but I'm gonna start paying for Apple Music soon the only reason I haven't yet is bc I don't have a credit card yet(I'm 15). Lastly, and idk if this is just my phone, but sometimes when I'm on an ad, it won't let me get out of it. It won't let me look at my other playlists or search something or anything. So idk if that was intentional or not. That's all! Everything else is great and I loveeee this app! Idk what I would do without itüòÖ

author: Walk it off ho3
title: Lack of transparency
content: It kinda bothers me that when i had downloaded this app again as i do every once and a while when i get offered a  deal on the subscription, i noticed that the UI that was present in first few minutes was nice and sleek more modern if you will and i liked it (aesthetically speaking) well in minutes i realized it reverted to the dull  basic UI and it was so off putting. I contacted Spotify and they told me to wait while they looked into it 3 times telling me thanks for your patience blah blah, after 15 minutes the message I received was "we don't have any information to offer on this issue, thanks for contacting Spotify" and they ended the chat‚Ä¶ Classic corporate runaround‚Äî"we're looking into it" followed by radio silence and a generic brush-off. They know it's intentional (like A/B testing) but aren't allowed to admit it because it would cause backlash from users upset they're stuck with the "ugly" version. I never singed up for AB testing and don't know why I'm selected for it this is not the first time my UI always changes into some basic trash and I'm premium if someone is paying for the service they deserve the most updated UI why do some users get to have it and others don't? This really was it for me after these 2 months going back to Apple Music exclusively.

title: Overrated

AND WHEN IM TRYING TO LISTEN TO MUSIC ON A PLAYLIST, IT PLAYS RANDOM "RECOMMENDED" SONGS THAT ARE NOT ON MY PLAYLIST. The false hope is the worst part, because after dealing with constant ads they like to tell you "enjoy your 30 minutes of uninterrupted listening" then it gives you an ad 5 minutes later. Would rather give my phone a virus and use wired earbuds then have to suffer on this app.

author: Max Bilbow
title: No longer safe for your screen addicted kids.
content:
We manage our kids' screen-time and have always viewed music and audiobooks as something that should always be available. 

My daughter is now old enough to use the main Spotify app but there's a catch: all those horrible addictive YouTube videos are now on Spotify. 

Why? Who wants this? Why do I have zero control over my kids' accounts and why can I not disable videos for them?

As a family account subscriber, this is a real dealbreaker for me. I want my kids to enjoy and appreciate music. But Spotify is no longer appropriate for this.

author: Matthew Cohman
title: üåñ
content: It doesn't keep the songs on your playlist when you get a new phone despite having an account. The app crashes too much. A lot of times it says "Spotify offline" and you have to reset your playlist which doesn't always work. It will say "you need wifi to download songs" despite the songs already being downloaded and you're paying premium so you can use Spotify offline. Also the app is so slow. If you have your playlist on shuffle it doesn't always play all your songs and restarts from the first song in that specific shuffle. Songs keep appearing on my playlist that I haven't added to it so I have to keep restarting the playlist because it's music I'm not interested in. Sometimes it will change a version of a song you have on your playlist to a censored version of the song without you doing so. I'll be listening to my playlist at the gym. Then when I get ready for work in the morning the same exact songs will play in the same order so I don't get to listen to my whole playlist most times.

 While I'm playing a 'best of' a band, I clearly do not want to listen to an irrelevant inferior band's song. 

Do something about it.

author: Pepperrocks5
title: The age of AI and everything apps is ruining good products
content:
All AI generated playlists by Spotify are awful. There used to be some kind of sense when a song was recommended on Spotify radio, but now all playlists blur into one and you can tell the algorithm is basing its song choices off of incorrect characteristics. 

The UI is now not optimised for navigating your library or playlists and I'm constantly pushed terrible music that someone has paid to promote to me.

author: Jorwal96
title: The best music streaming service
content:
Spotify is just the best music streaming service & I've been a subscriber for over a decade, but there's a definitely room for a few improvements.

The first is the price of premium - it's expensive, but you are getting a good service.

Secondly, the AI DJ is fantastic but it would be better if you could queue up your own songs between the suggestions - if you've got the DJ playing, songs you queue up aren't actually queued & you need to start playing a specific song/playlist to get the queue functionality to work.

title: If there were free alternatives I would switch

The only reason I didn't give it one star is because I will continue to use it, however not buy premium as it is overpriced. The thing that annoys me the most about  using Spotify on mobile with no premium is that I could want to listen to one song specifically, and I'll search for it, click on it to be met with some random song. Bear in mind you only get 6 skips an hour, so you may not even get to listen to the song you wanted to if it takes more than 6 skips to finally listen to it. It's also annoying that you can't go back to the previous song or any timeframe within the song itself.

author: its amazingly amazing!
title: good !!
content:
i really like spotify and always listen to my playlists whenevr i'm bored, but there's a few things i would change .

#1: when i listen to a playlist for too long, it starts playing random songs that aren't even on my playlist? i have tried googling it and switching it off on settings, but it still happens. pleaseee fix it ‚òπÔ∏è

#2: when you don't have spotify premium, i get you are meant to have ads but seriously there's like three 30 second ones in a row and then it says "30 minutes of uninterrupted listening" and then gives you 3 more like 5 minutes later, it's really annoying . 

#3: i don't know if they still do this, but when you don't have spotify premium you have a limit on seeing the lyrics per MONTH??? having a limit on seeing the lyrics is a bad idea anyways, but per month is just crazy üò≠ 

#4: it often lags, like my app is updated and i have full bars but sometimes when i click on spotify it just kicks me off and wont let me on the app. i dunno why it's doing this, i've googled it many times but it's not my phone that's the problem sooo ü§®‚Ä¶..

anyways, apart from that the app is really good! i spend hours listening to music every day and i am literally addicted to it ü´° 

hehehehehe baiii :3

author: Fatkid!
title: Great!
content: Great! Thanks. Really enjoying hearing some of the old music I knew and either have, lost or missed over the years. Equally, I loving some of the old and fresh music I am now discovering and would probably have never heard. Spotify has also been great to refresh or familiarise myself of artists I am about to see at festivals, or make playlists of setlists of artists seen live. Only thing, which isn't really a complaint is, I often like to hear the original recordings and not all remastered versions of tracks/albums. Discovering also, so much other good things on here including audiobooks etc.

author: brishzveiabd
title: Random songs play
content:
I've been using Spotify for years with no issues.

However, lately, when I open the iOS app, it will play some random song within the genre of whatever I was listening to last. This never happened before. And my windows desktop app doesn't have this issue. 

Sometimes it does this while I'm actively listening to a playlist: I'll open the app to adjust the playlist and before I can do anything it'll play some random song and mess up my playlist. 

Honestly it's 5 star app. Thanks for the hard work. But this latest issue is so annoying that I feel the need to 1 star it for attention. Please developers, fix it.

author: SuperSquibbly
title: Becoming unstable
content: As a premium subscriber for a number of years, I'm finding that this app seems to be getting more unstable as the updates roll in.  This is not just occurring on my phone, but also on my partner's and my son's.  This occurs mostly when mobile, but usually occurs whenever I'm travelling either way of a journey.  Never had an issue with this app until the last few updates.  Each time this occurs, I check mobile reception and it's on 5G with full bars.  If this keeps up and is not resolved, it might be a deal breaker for us!

People are posting nudes
People are showing their parts
Sucking on stuff 
Having private time!
If you get this app for young kids, make them their own playlist and do not search ASMR or Joni's basement

author: the brawler COOKIE
title: My Absolute Fav
content: When it comes to listening to music, there are a ton of options! One that really stands out to me has got to be spotify. Im not saying the others are bad. Its just that Spotify is very generous, they dont force you to get the prenium account like other platforms. You can use the app without needing to upgrade, and Spotify won't bother you and won't rub it in your face that this is better. They want you to enjoy it, and care about the quality of their app. They consider quality before money, and that is the formula to success. They dont have their own ads etc. The features and qualities of this app are awesome and outweigh others. People don't want to spend money on listening to music, they just want enjoy and have it. Quality is very limited in the world. And boy, Spotify have succeeded in finding it.

author: ghdhdkajs
title: Spotify, fix your app
content: Spotify might be the biggest money grab of all time behind capcut. I'm practically being forced into buying premium because of this BS. On my playlist I delete a few songs and then add a couple more. I know that if you don't have 15 songs on your playlist it randomly selects songs based off your 'interests'. So can someone tell me why Spotify is playing the songs I removed? I removed them for a reason, so keep them off my playlist. And you know what makes it worse? Over time spotify plays more and more songs I don't want on my playlist and they progressively get worse and worse over time so when I skip all the songs I don't want I'm forced to listen to utterly horrible music. If anyone can help me fix this issue that would be great because I can't be arsed buying premium.

author: _üé∂_
title: money.
content: SPOTIFY IS MY FAVOURITE APP BUT im in high school (31 üîÑ). how am i supposed to pay $167 per year for premium? iv never paid for premium because my parents think its a "waste of money". I get it, you probably don't want to pay for an online experience for your child. but i could pay for it myself, right? wrong. i get $20 a month, and since premium is $13.99 a month i AM able to do it. but imagine you had to give 70% of your salary to someone every month. how would that feel? it would practically limit me from buying anything else. what am i supposed to buy with $6 in this economy? a piece of candy? and i know I'm young but I'm not clueless. I know prices are rising and the earths is drastically changing, but isn't it possible for there to be a cheeper premium were we're only allowed to access download songs and not have ads? cmon, im sure thousands of other people agree with me. Im sure one of you'r hundreds of developers have considered this. so why haven't you made it a possibility? anyways, not hate to spotify, I LOVE THE APP, but cmon‚ÄºÔ∏è

author: Ian Ma 1998
title: Password Issue / Boring
content:
Apart from turning into a boring app that keeps recommending songs I just listened to, it also stopped working in Chrome.

I tried deleting my browsing history and using incognito mode‚Äînothing worked. Eventually, I switched to Safari, but it doesn't work well there either. Every few songs, the audio goes mute.

While trying incognito mode, I had to use a code sent to my email, which worked for signing in. However, I later received an email saying that due to suspicious activity, I had to reset my password. Now, all my devices‚Äîincluding my car‚Äîhave to be signed in again and again.

This level of security and hassle doesn't make sense for a music app. Even my bank account isn't that strict. They could easily verify everything through the phone I've been signed in on for years.

author: 1972Êõæ
title: Love the app and everything about it but a little problem to it
content: I love Spotify! It has every music possible and when i want to listen, i can! It's personally really easy to use and very convenient. Unfortunately, since i've been on an holiday in China, the app has some issues to it. I don't have Spotify premium, and suddenly, whenever i play a random playlist, song or anything i can find or search up, everything says i need Spotify permuim. The song i used to play are all locked, reminding me i need Spotify premium. I'm not sure if its because i changed a location but didn't update my location in the app, or it's just a glitch. If i get back to my country again, and it still happens, i'm pretty sure somethings wrong with the app. If not, then i'm pretty sure its just the restrictions China has. The app is amazing over all and i definitely recommend it, but there are bugs and i wish it could get fixed! ‚ù§Ô∏è

author: s;lkdfv;wlkeo
title: Extremely greedy
content:
Is it your goal to make the free version unusable? It is genuinely so infuriating how you keep taking away features from the free version and make them exclusive for premium. Honestly disappointing how greedy you guys are üòê. First, you ALREADY play what feels like thousands of ads, then take lyrics away, and now you force us to use smart shuffle (which is a very bad feature, ESPECIALLY when you force us to use it). Smart shuffle sucks. What if I don't want to listen to any other songs?? What if im trying to listen to someones album? I don't want to be bombed with songs that are not in that album, or even from the same artist. Let people play what they want to play. Not cool.

 1 Year Update: You've made it even worse. Now I'm not even able to play songs I want to play since thats now apparently a premium feature. Instead when i try that, you give me four ads in a row and play a different song. And now you've also brought back the 6 skips per hour thing as well. Why do you try to make this app unusable? Do you really care about your user quality or just money? Also I STILL get bombed with smart shuffle songs and now when I skip them I lose my 6 skips for the hour. If you really care about your customers then remove this stuff. Remove smart shuffle or make it happen less, give us unlimited skips like before, and actually let us play the songs we want to play. Why can't you make this app like the computer version??? Im fine with the computer version because it's usable but you guys are genuinely disgusting when it comes to the phone version. Do better.

author: SharperZero
title: From a premium subscriber: DO NOT UPGRADE TO PAID, App functionality at an all time low
content: The app has been riddled with disappointing glitches and issues that make me heavily consider going back to physical media or god forbid Apple Music. As of right now if I try to scroll to a specific section in my liked songs, without fail it will make me go all the way to the bottom, not where I'm trying to go. This has been an ongoing issue but now it's not just my liked songs :( and this year I found the Spotify wrapped to be the most disappointing one as of yet, with none of the thought and effort put into it that made me want to subscribe to Spotify in the first place (probably because the folks who actually made the dang thing were first up on the chopping block for lay offs). Combine both of those already pressing issues with the ever increasing price for a service no longer maintaining it's functionality, I think I can speak for us all when I say (as a nearly ten year subscriber to Spotify premium) that Spotify is no longer the choice for those Audiophiles among us.

author: Rood34
title: The over complicated and bad shuffling makes it not worth your time
content: Spotify's shuffle system feels like it's trying to outsmart itself‚Äîand failing. Instead of just, you know, shuffling, it tries to guess what you want to hear next based on who-knows-what, and the result is a mess. Songs repeat too often, others never show up, and the whole thing ends up feeling more like a curated loop than a true shuffle. It shouldn't take this much effort to hear my own music randomly. I'm giving it 3 stars because the rest of the app is fine, but the shuffle kills the experience.

author: bwrogers93
title: Best music app available
content: Spotify is one of the best music streaming apps available, offering millions of songs, podcasts, and playlists at your fingertips. The app is easy to navigate, and personalized recommendations like Discover Weekly and Daily Mixes keep the listening experience fresh and exciting. Whether you're into mainstream hits or hidden gems, Spotify makes it simple to find and enjoy music anywhere. The free version is great, and the Premium upgrade removes ads and lets you download songs for offline listening ‚Äî totally worth it for music lovers.

author: afrobian
title: I moved to Apple Music
content: I moved to Apple Music after 8 years with this company. Why? because Spotify keeps feeding me music I already have in my library in the discovery and Daylist stations ‚Ä¶ now if the point is to discovering new music why is that 90% of the music I ALREADY HAVE.  Apple Music is much better if you take time to get used to their UI.  Also shoving podcasts in my throat is bananas. Have a separate dedicated app for that.  I'm not going back to Spotify but I hope you take this feedback seriously for the sake of your subscribers.

author: franny8553
title: So many issues
content: I have had this app for over a year after switching from Apple Music to try it out. I am switching back to Apple Music for several reasons. The algorithm is really off and I'm convinced it makes the artists play this weird game to beat the algorithm in order to get plays. Overall it plays the same suggested songs that I don't want. There is no recently played playlist that Apple Music has and does very well. My top artists were people I know I dont listen to nearly enough to have them on the top artists list. Making a playlist is so time consuming because you have to add each on individually. Whereas Apple Music you can search and add as many songs as you like on one go. The only reason I switched to Spotify was to go on my partners plan but now we both hate it. I really think Spotify should work on making their app more user friendly like Apple. I will say there are some songs Spotify has that Apple doesn't and vice versa but it's not enough of a difference to want to keep Spotify and at the end of the day you can YouTube any song.

author: Manguyman
title: Audio books
content:
I was initially excited when audiobooks were added,  but it seems that they only added them to make people mad, I have a full subscription,  but half way through a book I was notified there is a un-advertised limit to audiobook listening.  No where does it give you more info if you hit this limit so better keep trying every day if you want to keep listening.  If you listen to too much music in between listening to your book, Spotify will hide that book from you so you can't easily find and resume listening.
The app in general has been consistently getting worse for the approx 8 years I've had it

author: Yippieeeyahoo
title: I genuinely hate this app üíî
content:
I used to like it, when I was able to play anything from my liked songs freely until I apparently only have 6 skips per hour‚Ä¶? Plus when I play a specific genre of music in my liked songs it switches to a completely different genre entirely and says that all of my songs are now randomly selected. It really makes me angry because I just want to listen to a specific genre to match my vibe, but I can't do that if this dumb app keeps begging me for premium. It's pathetic, and ruins experiences for newer listeners.
Also, I found that a few weeks ago I was able to copy some songs from my liked songs playlist + transfer them to another to match the vibe I'm going for, but it's gone, so now I have to manually bring ALL of my newer liked songs into that playlist. A little side note, or the least you could do is add a select button. 
I'm not sure if it's just my trashy phone or if it's just the incompetence and ignorance of you app.

author: taebaeck
title: please let me undo 'remove this song from playlist'
content:
its all good and all but,
1. i constantly press 'remove this song from playlist' while trying to add it to another playlist by mistake. the UI are very close to each other and i assume i will be repeating the same mistake again as I am bad with mobile devices and often have trouble pressing exactly what i want, unless i'm staring right at it! haha. i think it'd be better to have 'undo' option for the popup that says it successfully removed the song, instead of changing the arrangement to make UIs stay apart etc. just like how the popup shows up when i add a song to a playlist by pressing plus icon in song detail screen, and it has 'change' option on the right. 

2. i keep seeing k-music recommendations(not only kpop but as a whole) based on my region, but i prefer to explore more songs from other countries. hopefully that is something feasible in later updates.

but in general, i am satisfied

author: Lynx-spain
title: Spotify, It's Time to Lead Again
content:
I've been using Spotify Premium for years and love it for its vast library and intelligent algorithm, but I feel it's starting to fall behind. Not only in terms of audio quality, but also in its overall design and innovation. The interface is beginning to feel cluttered, and at times, counterintuitive. If any changes are urgent, it's the user interface ‚Äî this is the first impression for every listener, and it should feel modern, clean, and intuitive. Customers should immediately feel that Spotify is the number one music streaming service the moment they open the app.

Right now, many users stay not because it's the best, but because it's what their friends use. That kind of network effect won't last forever ‚Äî especially as competitors continue to refine their offerings. If another service emerges that offers cross-platform compatibility, superior or even the same audio quality, but with a cleaner, more forward-thinking design, Spotify could lose ground quickly.

Given the pace of innovation across tech and social media platforms, there's no reason Spotify shouldn't be leading the charge. With the tools, data, and creative power it has access to, it could introduce features that completely redefine what a music app can be. One idea is allowing users to save segments of songs ‚Äî not just the full track ‚Äî for custom playlists. Imagine building a gym playlist made entirely of high-energy hooks or fast-paced verses to help control your tempo during a run or training session. Or a study mix composed of ambient intros and instrumental bridges. These "music quotes" would let listeners curate mood-specific playlists with surgical precision. It would be a game-changer for personalization and give users more control over how they experience music.

Spotify could also embrace the tech world's playbook and launch these features during yearly live or recorded keynote events. This would build excitement, create a sense of community, and reinforce Spotify's image as a true innovator in the audio space.

Additionally, introducing a modern take on live radio could bring a fresh dynamic to the platform. Think live-streaming the most-heard global hits in real time or giving users access to traditional FM radio stations within Spotify's ecosystem ‚Äî complete with the ability to instantly save a song from a broadcast to a personal playlist. It would merge the nostalgia and spontaneity of traditional radio with the convenience and control of digital streaming.

Spotify has the infrastructure, user base, and brand loyalty to lead the industry forward ‚Äî but it needs to start acting like the leader again. And that begins with reimagining the interface and showing users that the best is yet to come.

Signed, a loyal customer who really doesn't want to leave ‚Äî but will, if things don't start to move forward.

author: Chua HC
title: Nice app but bad communication
content:
My Family premium Plan expired because 1 of my plan owner moved house updated his address and now address is different. I had a live chat with their staff who said she resolved it for me by confirming address on backend and I'll still get premium plan after 16 March deadline. On 16 March my premium Plan was discontinued despite assurances that it's resolved !

Very bad communication on Spotify's part on not clearly communicating what I needed to do earlier and misinforming me that it's already resolved when it's not. 

They just kept repeating that it's not their intention to make it difficult for me and about family Premium Plan owner and members must live at the same address.

Their app is very good with a huge database of songs. Their customer service replies very fast but have to learn to be clearer in communication and apologise immediately when they made a mistake.

author: S!DD
title: Persistent Apple Watch Volume Dial Issue
content: The volume dial intermittently stops working in Spotify when using an Apple Watch. Despite hardware and software updates, the problem persists, affecting the overall user experience. A fix from Spotify would be greatly appreciated.

content:
I signed up for Spotify Premium with a 2-month offer (14-day free trial + 2 months for ‚Çπ119). However, after just 14 days, my account was downgraded, and I lost access to Premium. To make matters worse, Spotify didn't refund my money or provide any solution.

author: It'snotbadiguess
title: It's ok
content: WHEN DID SMART SHUFFLE BECOME NON-PREMIUM? I only have the option smart shuffle. The rest says it's PREMIUM. WHAT?! That's not all, I can only pick songs for a certain amount each day AND I can only change songs 6 times per hour. I don't understand what's going on lately it's been going on for months! The songs are good but i just don't understand what's going on. It was working fine on my other account but on this one? I just can't take it anymore.                                                                                                   I'm not saying that Spotify is a bad app, it's just that I think these problems should be fixed. I understand that not all these problems might not be fixed and that it might just be a problem in my account but in case anyone else does have this problem it should be fixed.

title: Premium is ridiculous
content:
This whole premium Thing is ridiculous I have to pay to not get ads ABOUT PAYING TO NOT GET ADS paying for stuff that used to be free even just the smallest stuff needs premium ever thought about some people not being in the position to pay also I use Spotify instead of Apple Music because you didn't have to pay and now you have to pay in Spotify as well it's a music app there is no reason to be needing to pay for basic services like skipping TOO MUCH or READING LYRICS or even choosing WHAT SONG I WANT TO PLAY it's ridiculous now I understand get the money but there should be a limit before it's too much cuz now I'm just thinking about buying premium so I don't have to see ads ABOUT PREMIUM at this point they just keep adding new problems to force us to buy premium.
Spotify is not a bad app and premium is also not a bad idea  for business so I'm not saying remove premium I'm saying reduce the feeling of being obligated to buy premium to properly use Spotify and it's not expensive I'll give you that but some people are not in a position to be purchasing things sometimes

author: Fyei_
title: There has to be a better way
content:
Whenever when I was in the middle of playing a Playlist, then sometimes I came across a song, whether it's suggested by Spotify in one way or another, then I listened to it halfway and deemed it's worth to try to go to the Artist's profile to listen to a few more songs, before deciding whether it's worth Following that Artist or not. 
But there's no easy way to add ,for example the top 10 songs or 5 most recent singles ,of that Artist to my Queue / add to my Other Playlists. 
There has to be a better, easier, more seamless way in the Spotify UI to do this, sort of a mini "Audition" if you will, from that Artist, to me, before I decide if I like them enough to Follow. Then afterwards, seamlessly continuing listening to the next items in the Playlist where I left off.
It'd be great if there's a way in the UI buttons to easily add the top 10 most popular songs from that Artist to my Other Playlist, 4-6 most recent Singles, all songs from 1-2 most recent Album. Maybe even, plus 3 or so more songs from that Artist that Spotify Algorithm deems I would like or suit my taste, even if it's NOT a popular song or it's released a long time ago, but might help convince me to like that Artist enough to decide to Follow. 
If there's a way to specify/customize each of those numbers, of how many songs of each categories [Popular/RecentSingles/RecentAlbums/SpotifyThinksYouMightLike] to add to my Other Playlists/Queue, that'd be great. Maybe something like a scrolling number, like how UI in choosing a number of hours/minutes/seconds for a Timer/Alarm, those kinds of UI.

author: kannaboso69
title: Inconsistent UI
content: The UI in Spotify isn't user friendly, mainly because of useless thing (like shorts/reel vids in Spotify) and i can tell that the user library management isn't being put too much thought into, because its way too general (you only have favorite and the rest is custom). Should've created algorithm that can both generate and recommend playlist that are custom made for unique user. Having a "if you like x artist, then you must like yzw artists" type of playlist doesn't help either. For me personally, it's not hitting even the slightest vibe and that's such a shame for a big music app like Spotify. Not to mention the inconsistent features on different OS, oh it's such a headache. I feel like i can ramble about the application quality on this app but that would take forever. All i can say is your biggest worth is your ability to listen to constructive criticism, and i am giving you one for free.

author: TtuitNL
title: Spotify goes streaming without admission‚Ä¶
content:
Today (as i am traveling on my holiday on a foreign country) i was playing music which i yesterday downloaded at home via my wifi and made it my traveling playlist. But, as i was driving and listening, suddenly, i didn't recognize one of the songs‚Ä¶ I first thought, it is possible because there was a lot of French music which i didn't really knew, but very soon i noticed, Spotify just automatically stopt playing the list and just random started streaming random music. Without permission that is!!!!!!! The settings where right. But still. So as soon as i was sure of it, stopped it ofcourse. But it was to late‚Ä¶ Spotify already used a rather big gap in my data-bundle, which just today was set for a new month‚Ä¶ Not happy with that Spotify!! This joke had cost me to much data, and now i am not sure if i manage to make it till the end of the month. Thanks (sarcastic ofcourse)üëéüèº
2025-04: Since spotify made some mayor changes like home-adres control and raising payments, there are mayor issues just playing (or better said: not playing/no sound) especially when streaming on other divises like my tv‚Ä¶ Getting horrible SPOTIFY!

author: bdujbxyu
title: Spotify's Local File Sync Is a Nightmare ‚Äî Especially for Audiobooks
content:
Spotify's local file sync feature is an absolute nightmare. I spent hours trying to get MP3 files ‚Äî clean, properly tagged, even re-encoded ‚Äî to sync from my Mac to my iPhone. The process sounds simple: add local files, create a playlist, download the playlist on your phone. Except it doesn't work.

The playlist shows up on iPhone. The files show up. The "Download" toggle flips. But nothing actually downloads. Try to play the file? You get:

"Song not downloaded. If you own the song, you can sync it from your computer."

Well ‚Äî I do own the file. I am trying to sync it from my computer. But Spotify refuses.

I stripped embedded artwork, cleaned metadata, re-encoded the files using FFmpeg, created fresh playlists, used new folders, reinstalled the app, rebooted the phone, used the same Wi-Fi, Nothing works.

And all of this while I'm paying top dollar for Spotify Premium.

To make things worse, I couldn't even find playback speed controls ‚Äî let alone pitch correction ‚Äî which is pretty standard in audiobook players. I gave up and switched to BookPlayer: it's free, open source, has proper speed controls with pitch correction, and importing files takes literal seconds.

Spotify is ok for streaming music, but if you're trying to listen to your own audiobooks or personal audio on mobile ‚Äî look elsewhere. This feature is broken and unsupported, and clearly not a priority.

With that being said. So long, goodbye.

author: jo-ry
title: ok, but not more
content:
The UI is designed for people who don't have their own taste of music and who listen whatever the "intelligence" of spotify wants them to listen. 
Whatever I listen, spotify keeps adding horrible music by changing the style of music I'm listening. This "intelligence" is meant to unify the style of music people listen, it makes music more mainstream and more boring. 
For audiobooks and podcasts spotify is one of the worst players you could imagine. I strongly suggest to use a podcast player for podcasts, there is much more comfort. Of course spotify nudges you to listen to podcasts, because they don't pay the podcasters while it costs them money if you listen to music. 
The spotify originals are rather bad productions - content is secondary, sound effects and simplicity go first.
The app is gerting worse and worse. Lately they added videos that flicker around everywhere - ugly and annoying.

My mom has been paying The family subscription for years so we can all use it. I went living abroad and been using Spotify since. Today they decided that I would be excluded of my mom's family plan as we don't live in the same country anymore‚Ä¶ I'm still her family even if I live abroad. I've been using this app for years, and today it stops. Just subscribed to YouTube premium which is so much better as you have music and video content.. gonna keep the app until I'm able to pass all my playlist to YT. 
Bye Spotify, your era has ended

author: Yury1988
title: Travels unfriendly
content: Spotify's 14-day limit for using the service in a different country without changing account settings is incredibly inconvenient. It unnecessarily complicates things for travelers or anyone temporarily abroad, forcing users to update settings and even adjust linked services like Facebook or Apple. This rigid regional restriction feels outdated and user-unfriendly compared to other streaming platforms.

author: Queerly
title: Miserable experience
content: I've stopped using the app. I stopped Spotify premium subscription some time ago, I just wasn't using it often enough to warrant the expense. All was good for a while, the adds were a bit annoying at times, especially when they play the same add twice in a row, but I think that's on purpose to make it as irritating as possible for non-paying users, which is fair game. Lately, in my region, they've started playing adds asking for donations for war refugees. I understand the good cause, but - like most people - I listen to music to relax and escape the reality, and constantly being reminded about the misery out there in the world defeats the purpose. I do not want to diminish the tragedy of what the people suffering from the atrocities from war are going through, but having those adds repeated after every 3 songs is somewhat triggering. And it's not like the adds go away once you donate, since I already donate regularly to charitable causes. The only way to make them go away is to "donate" to Spotify. I don't mind ads like that for news apps or YouTube and such like, but on Spotify they feel out of touch. I think Spotify should curate their adds better.

author: deodorant isana candy sky
title: 18+ content
content:
First of all, I really enjoy this app, love the podcasts, songs and everything. But something about this app is VERY wrong. You see, on podcasts (video and audio) there is a lot of UNCOVERED sus content that is in any way not for kids. And here I mean LGBTQ+ content, 18+ content and stuff like that. And you might think it's fine... If you do you probably need a brain replacement, because these types of videos are uncovered and anybody can see it, including kids. Imagine a little kid scrolling through spotify that can't read, for example looking for a song like Baby Shark and an 18+ video that someone posted on their podcast pops up and that kid clicks it... They're gonna be traumatized for the rest of their life. I'm sorry, but why is that type of content considered for 'All ages'?

Another thing are ads. I have Spotify Premium now, but I don't want people who don't have it to suffer thru this much ads. i'm talking about 2 ads every 4 songs. When you dislike an ad it automatically shows you even MORE ads!

Overall the app is very good but please do something about these things I talked about. 

ty caseoh

author: Maxime Kopp
title: Real issue I don't want to see here
content:
Hello, I have a prenium subscription since at least 2022. Never had any issue with Spotify until lately. I can't keep my playlist going when I switch from Computer to IPhone. It never synchronizes properly. 

Second point that bother me for real and could lead me to unsubscribe is : I don't want to see sponsorized content on my Spotify. I AM PAYING TO DODGE THAT. If it keep going, I will cut my subscription and buy Album like we used to do in the past. If I got 10‚Ç¨ per month for u, I can buy a couple of albums during the years. Don't forget it Spotify, while u are useful, u can be replaced without any difficulty. I don't care at all about my data and all that stuff. I listen music with ear, I'm not trying to be in contest with others fans to know who's the bigger Stan.

author: ‚Ä¢Giorgino‚Ä¢
title: I need a better mixer - equalizer in the app.
content:
Imagine being able to mix your favorite tunes with healing frequencies 528hz, 369, 963, 432, 1111hz, etc.

But also have a mixer integrated in the app that allows you to add, effect, and just possibilities for audio creation.

An audio tool integrated into all our favorite music.

We live in the age of AI, 2025! Apps that don't evolve eventually get boring, obsolete, or just average such the case of social media apps, dating apps, etc.

Companies MUST offer better services for their customers, and grow accordingly WITHOUT bleeding our wallets.

I do believe that Spotify has much way to walk yet.

author: Omnib01
title: Spotify user for 10 years
content:
The service is 5/5 but the app is 3/5.

Service: you can chose what quality to to stream in, highest is good enough for almost all uses. Lets you download lists and listen offline. 

App:
sometimes the team add/remove or relocate functions without explanation and to some subjective annoyance. 
Silly problems like if you use enhanced playlist, you cant "swipe" to que a song, only click for the drop down menu, makikg me not use enhanced playlist despite liking the idea.

Listening session that you can invite people to is also great but needs some fine tuning and sync tuning.

title: Playlists, genre, price
content:
When I press add to playlist, I would like to be able to see the playlist it is already part of - first, they should show at the top. Now I have to go an search folder my folder to find the playlist. 

I would like to see genre for each song. 

I would like to be able to rearrange the lists on my phone, not just on the computer - which I never use. 

I think the premium is too expensive. -40% would be fair. But that is related to how much I use it. I understand that for super user it would not be enough. Maybe have to groups of payers, a light version and a super user version. And you pay light, and once the hours of listening goes above a certain limit, it would become a super month and charge that extra.

author: Marianne N√∏rr
title: Feed back
content:
Hej Spotify. Jeg har i mange √•r benytte mig af Deezer. For at samle vores k√∏b af musik til et sted (b√∏rnene vandt) fik min mand og jeg ogs√• Spotify.
Det er et godt produkt, men fra Deezer, savner jeg, at jeg jeg med f√¶rre "klik" kan gemme en sang og derved meget hurtigere kan lave en playliste. Jeg synes ogs√• overskueligheden med min mange playlister var bedre ved Deezer. 

Hvis jeg skal v√¶lge en sang under "numre/sange", s√• synes jeg ikke at alle kunstnerens sange fremg√•r. Der skal jeg ind under "album" for at lede. Jeg synes ogs√• at en og samme sang bliver vist flere gange, i stedet for kun √©n gang. Jeg mener selvf√∏lgelig ikke en sang som er lavet i forskellige genre.

Jeg har ogs√• oplevet at hvis jeg KUN vil h√∏re Phil Collins, s√• mikser Spotify, en anden kunstner ind efter ca hvert 3. nummer??

Ellers super fedt at I oplyser om koncerter og nye sange fra de kunstnere som jeg har som favoritter.

I m√• gerne kontakte mig, hvis jeg skal uddybe.

Mange nyt√•rs hilsner fra Marianne

author: Noah Sylvester
title: The Ultimate Gateway to Musical Nirvana üé∂
content:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

Imagine a world where every melody ever composed, every beat ever dropped, and every lyric ever penned is right at your fingertips. That world exists‚Äîand it's called Spotify.

Spotify isn't just an app; it's a revolution. It's my personal DJ, a time machine to my childhood hits, and the curator of my future favorites. Its algorithm knows me better than I know myself, weaving playlists that feel like they're plucked straight from my soul. Whether I'm running, working, partying, or just needing a moment to breathe, Spotify provides the perfect soundtrack every time.

The user interface? Sleek and intuitive. The sound quality? Crystal-clear magic. And let's talk about Discover Weekly‚Äîit's not just a playlist; it's an adventure! Every Monday feels like Christmas morning as I unwrap new songs to fall in love with.

Spotify has turned silent car rides into karaoke nights, dull workouts into adrenaline-pumping sessions, and quiet evenings into deep, introspective journeys. It's more than an app; it's a lifestyle.

If music is the universal language, Spotify is its most eloquent translator. Download it, and I guarantee it'll be the best decision you've ever made. Bravo, Spotify! üëè

P.S. To whoever coded the "crossfade" feature: I owe you my life.

author: Meganka
title: Unusable
content: I recently stopped being a premium user and wow, what an unpleasant surprise. Free version of Spotify is basically impossible to use: you cannot listen to a song of your choice, you cannot skip more than 6 per hour and you cannot even hit play on a playlist you created. I was prepared for multiple ads but not this. Congrats on making the use of the app such a miserable experience. I was full on planning to find a workaround for my troubles with PayPal payment, but I'd rather choose a service that treats its potential customers a little better.

Spotify does not give any option to this, but still want my consent, they want me to "choose".  How can I give my consent and choose, when there is no other alternative? 

It would be fair for all of us fir Sopify to say "we will force this, you have no other alternative".

Well, actually there are alternatives like YouTube.

author: Sieger des Volkes
title: Premium with ads?!
content:
I'm paying for Premium ‚Äì good money ‚Äì and yet I'm getting ad breaks while listening to podcasts.
Before, at least I could skip them. Sure, having to grab my phone was annoying enough, but at least it was possible.
Now I can't even do that. I'm forced to listen to Coca-Cola ‚Äì the world's biggest plastic polluter ‚Äì telling me how they're saving the planet with glass bottles. Thanks for the greenwashing.

And the best part? The app doesn't even remember where it left off in a podcast. Sometimes it skips 20 minutes, sometimes it skips the whole episode.
Great job. Not.

Honestly, Apple Music is better. I can hear Spotifys podcasts without paying for Premium.

author: RominRonin
title: Stagnation due to market dominance
content:
Spotify has all the songs, but it's missing truly innovative features to help me find what I want to. The discovery features are in need of renewal. Some of the playback settings are just limited. Podcasts feel tacked on. The Price is great, but that comes at the cost of fair distribution to the smaller musicians.

Help me connect with local musicians, take steps in consolidating and supporting local communities. Do more than just taking in the Cash like all the other big tech monopolies.

Our favourite music artists were idealists who broke the mold. Spotify is beginning to stink like mould.

author: Nick17689
title: Excessive Sponsored Recomendations in Spotify Premium
content:
I've been using the premium version of this app for quite some time, but I've recently noticed a significant increase in sponsored recommendations. One of the main reasons I subscribed to the spotify premium was to avoid excessive ads and distractions. However, it feels like the number of sponsored content has dramatically grown, which reduces the value of the premium experience.

While I understand that some sponsored content might be necessary, the current amount seems excessive, especially for paying subscribers. I would appreciate it if this issue could be reconsidered to ensure that premium users receive the ad-free or low-ad experience they're paying for.

author: Nusti4
title: Nice app, but some issues with (smart) shuffle features
content:
I like the app, but in my opinion the shuffle option needs some improvements. Every time I want to listen songs in shuffle option, so that they are randomly played, they are always played according the same "shuffle" order. 
The same goes for smart shuffle. Only sometimes I get new songs recommendations when listening in smart shuffle, but mostly I hear the same songs all over. I am really struggling when I want to listen to something new (but similar to my playlist songs), which I believe is the main goal of the smart shuffle.
Could you please somehow improve an algorithms of the shuffle and smart shuffle options so that the songs are properly mixed and not played the same all the time? 
Thank you!

author: markus1777
title: Programmed obsolescence
content: Spotify has officially joined the ranks of apps like Netflix and the like that follow Apple's policy of programmed obsolescence: although the app worked fine on my iPad running iOS 9.X.X until this morning, it's now impossible to sign in to my premium account; there's no connection between my device and Spotify's server. Not a network issue, just the company's policy of restricting access to the platform for older devices that can still run the app. That's a shame. I am now canceling my premium subscription.

author: LaKy1344
title: Crazy in 2025
content:
Spotify is great if you're just a passive listener. But the moment you try to build your own music system, it stops making sense.
	‚Ä¢	I can't share my "Liked Songs" playlist? Why? It's literally just a list of songs I like ‚Äî and I can't send it to anyone. So I have to create a private playlist and manually add the same songs there. And here comes the next issue:
	‚Ä¢	I can't easily add a new song with one click. When I hit "Add to playlist", it automatically goes to "Liked Songs". And no, I can't set a different playlist as my main one. Why is that not an option?
	‚Ä¢	Sorting by "date added" only works on the phone, not on PC. Why doesn't this basic feature work across devices?
	‚Ä¢	The same playlist looks completely different on different devices ‚Äî layout, colors, sorting. I control playback from my phone and listen on my PC, but each device shows it differently. What is that about?

Spotify, are you doing this on purpose? It's no longer a streaming service ‚Äî it's a logic puzzle to work around your own UX. And I'm losing.
Is this really what I'm paying for?

author: Honza U.
title: Accessibility issues
content: This app had been pretty good for blind people for its accessibility, but it is not any more. About half a year ago accessibility of the "Now playing" was screwed and from this time on the app is hardly usable. Whenever I enter this menu, the app fires events to skip tracks, usually to the previous one, sometimes even infinitelymany times. Also at the same screen the elapsed time bar stopped being accessible, despite previously it had been. So no option to easily shift within a song. The same problem when adding a song, which is being played, to a playlist. I open the Now playing in order to get available the button which offers adding to multiple plalists, and‚Ä¶ since I have just opened the Now playing menu, the app fired an event to skip to different trak. Very annoying.

author: rgjtfbjji
title: Great until you need their customer service
content: I lost money to their customer service and also my whole family and I couldn't use our family plan because of some mistake with the app. The customer service didn't help me, I chatted with 7 advisors at least, everybody had a different idea, but they didn't resolve my issue so far. We had to create new profiles on Spotify, because our former profiles couldn't join a premium plan twice a year. (And that would be understandable, but my first premium account stopped working and they ADVISED me to leave it and create another one haha.) My last chat with them took 3 hours with 4 different advisors who just kept me waiting and it ended with escalation to "specialised team". They reached me via mail to tell me that there is nothing they can do for me, but they can assure me, that they CAN SEE that my family members created new profiles and joined the family plan already, so there is actually no issue anymore. I really dont understand their behaviour and motivation. Or maybe I do - Spotify has no competition, so they know you don't have anywhere to leave, and that is why they don't have to worry with your concerns. What a shame!

author: Miner6769
title: Give Me a Refund ‚Äî Your App is a Complete Joke
content:
I've had enough. Spotify has been completely unusable. The app tells me I'm offline when I'm clearly connected, it won't load anything, lyrics don't show up, and songs won't even play after hitting pause. I deleted and reinstalled the app, reset my network settings, and tried everything. Now I can't even log back in because it claims there's "no connection." Absolute garbage.

I pay for Premium and this is what I get? A broken app and zero functionality?

I want a refund immediately. Not a workaround. Not a copy-paste "try reinstalling" message. Just refund my money and fix your broken platform. This is ridiculous.

author: Kisdagimacsek

It offers me music that is ok for the average people in my age rate, but my taste is far from my age group. It seems I cannot "teach" it, no matter what I listen it offers the same things I don't like, so it is not a great experience now. I started to use Spotify because of its great daily playlists, but now I'm hesitant to keep my subscription. Guys pls check the algorithm. You know how to do it right, I used it happily for years! fix it pls!

author: Mind7heGap
title: Wrong priorities
content:
- Constant A/B testing live instead of using a separate beta channel
- Unnecessary bloat like TikTok home feed or videos or the Add Playlist button in the dock now
- No feature parity: You can't rearrange playlists in the mobile app, you can't create folders and you can't play folders either. You need the web app for all these - but if you access the web app from mobile, Spotify will block access to these features in favour of touting their incapable, bare-bones mobile app that can't do the very things I'm trying to use the web app for üòá

author: GorogLeo
title: spotify free
content:
Yo, Spotify Free, you're a joke, it's true,
Messin' with my vibe like a DJ who blew.
You interrupt my flow with ads so lame,
Turnin' up the cringe, yeah, you're the one to blame.

Got me stuck in shuffle, can't pick my own tracks,
Five skips an hour? What kinda nonsense is that?
Your sound quality's trash, like it's stuck in the past,
Streamin' so weak, it could never last.

You say you're free, but you come with a cost,
My time and my patience, man, both are lost.
Playlists butchered, tracks all scattered,
Tryin' to enjoy music, but you leave it tattered.

I'm tryin' to chill, but you're killin' the vibe,
Your ads are so bad, they should be a crime.
Paywalls blockin' me, can't listen offline,
Your free version's garbage, not worth a dime.

Yo, Spotify Free, you're a second-rate clown,
Messin' with my beats, always bringin' me down.
Time to step aside, let the real music play,
Spotify Free, you just got slayed.

author: H-k-k
title: Be more transparent
content:
1. Searching the update history and I only can see a typical update message in all of your versions. Why not be transparent on what you release with each version so we know your new features? 
2. Endless list of features within the app, nothing advertised or communicated to the user. E.g today was the first time I see the Sleeper timer feature. Not sure where this got there. 
3. Adding a song to favorites. I mean the hi should be pretty easy, a heart (like you used to have) or a star. Common pattern in every app. The plus icon is confusing, I am still struggling to find it and searching for the heart one every single time. 
4. Leaving feedback for the product within the app. Shouldn't this be more accessible? I still have not find it, this is why I leave my feedback here.

author: nastarev
title: this is sad
content:
i thought that spotify would be the app that everyone needed after all these years to finally organize our music library. i feel like it's more of a toy than a serious application. and even worse a toy that does not respect the musicians, which would be really vital for an app like this to respect the creators.
in its use there are not all the necessary info about each song available to the user. even dates are not easy to find if there are any. the navigation is kind of crappy. the liked songs are not affecting a lot anything in the app and it would be important to do so. also the app is not giving me feedback on the followed artist, its like i never liked them.. and it is really important for the artists to be followed as this represents how many people are into them.this is a really hot variable these days, for good or for bad.this fact should be a reason to make the user want to follow a musician, chase the artist and this should be returned back to the user, reward him for following. now there no visible difference if i follow someone or not. the app does not even lead me to the artists i like. also when im on tv and playing a song i cannot visit the musician's page!i can only follow or unfollow. are there ways ro organize the artist i follow?why is there no information about when i liked each artist?or how many times have i heard each song maybe?the list goes on and on.it is a really poor app with unfortunately great significance in the music industry. thus it should be taken more seriously with respect to the user and the artist.

author: BreakHolloway
title: Poor experience
content:
An app where music in playlists doesn't sync properly between devices. If you add or remove music on one device, it may not sync on another for weeks, and the solutions on the website don't help.

How is it possible that a subscription-based app doesn't offer a way to report bugs or get direct support? The only option is to visit the website and leave a "review" there, without receiving any notifications directly in the app.

What kind of ridiculous method is this for verifying a paid family subscription? Why require an address for confirmation when this could be an optional feature instead of mandatory? For example, alternative verification methods could be added, or the requirement could be removed entirely.

- The Apple Watch app also has poor synchronization sometimes it can't even load half of a playlist.

author: Saroonh ipad
title: Why I think Spotify is now terrible
content:
About fifteen hours ago, Spotify got a new update. The general theme of the update was taking inspiration from other social media and entertainment apps, which I have no problem with conceptually. For example, you can now "save" songs to a list, like Pinterest, which is fine. However, things start to get interesting when clicking on playlists. When clicking on most of Spotify's playlists, you are met with a prompt: to "scroll through the songs." After clicking on this prompt, you are greeted by, essentially, a musical version of TikTok. You are given thirty seconds of a song from the playlist (usually the chorus) with a video overlay, hashtags, and buttons on the side to share, like, etc. At any time, you can swipe down, and are greeted with a 30 second snippet of the catchiest part of the next song. This horrifies me: let me talk about why.

Before we talk about Spotify, let's set up some context. We all know that albums are dying. Among other things, it mainly has to do with attention spans. Most don't have the time to listen to a full album. 90% of people only listen to individual songs. But some people also don't have the time to listen to a whole song. If they don't know a song yet, they might only listen to 10 seconds before judging. If they already know the song, they may often skip to the best part. We've seen this with TikTok virality: a song can top the charts with 99% of people only having listened to the best 20 seconds of it. In response, hits are getting much shorter, too. But what does this have to do with Spotify's new TikTok-like feature?

Well, now people can listen to all their music this way. Instead of listening to a song all the way through, Spotify can skip to the best thirty seconds of it for you. At any time, too, you can swipe down if the first 5 seconds of a song haven't caught your interest. The biggest failure of music platforms in recent times is not letting listeners be able to just listen to the one part they want to. If there's a viral TikTok song someone loves, they can't just listen to that part. They have to slog through the ENTIRE two-and-a-half minute song if they want to hear those twenty seconds they like! TWO AND A HALF MINUTES? WHO HAS TIME FOR THAT!? Spotify has become the first platform to fix this fault, and as others follow suit, people might not have the attention spans to listen to not just a full album, but a full song. Of course, I might be crazy. But the unsettling thing is: this very well might happen. And if short-form context keeps growing bigger, attention spans keep getting smaller, and song snippets keep going viral, it will happen. Death to the song. Wait and see.

TL,DR: As attention spans shrink and twenty-second audio clips go viral, people won't want to slog through the rest of the song just to hear the part they like. A new Spotify feature lets them listen to only their favorite thirty seconds instead of the whole song, and just like albums, songs may die too.

author: LG_DXB
title: No support for Shortcuts
content: Apple Music is pulling ahead of Spotify in terms of functionality and convenience, by virtue of Shortcuts alone. A growing trend amongst iOS users is the use of Shortcuts and custom widgets to customise their devices in a legit way - Spotify is being left behind due to their refusal to give even basic Shortcuts support/integration. There are thousands and thousands of shortcuts out there that call for a music player, and they are all forced to default to Apple Music. Thousands and thousands of custom widgets that are forced to integrate with Apple Music (often via Shortcuts).

author: hvarcegovac
title: Lack of content control and rating
content: Premium accounts contain some limited filtering and parental controls options. However, the main issue is that so much content is allowed to be uploaded to Spotify without enough having sufficient filtering options. Right now, anyone can upload a copy of a YouTube or TikTok video with all sorts of unrated content and there is no way to filter it out for different ages or types of users. Children can find all sorts of inappropriate content on this platform. Please put some effort into updating your platform. You've gone from being a great platform to listen to music and podcasts to being flooded with all sorts of subpar content, especially videos.

author: Dani.B.
title: We had a family premium and it stopped working
content:
I've been a loyal Spotify user for years, and my family and I have been subscribed to the Family Premium Plan. Everything was fine until recently when Spotify suddenly stopped working for us, claiming that we're not in the same country as our set location. 
The issue is that we all travel frequently for work, and now we can't even use the app, because it "detects" that we're not in the country. üò°
What's worse is that Spotify refuses to issue a refund, despite the fact that we're paying for a service we can't access. Very disappointed with the lack of flexibility and customer support! üò°üò°üò°

title: A recommendation !!!

author: aminey098
title: Bring Back the Old Group Session Feature
content:
Dear Spotify Team,
I'm incredibly disappointed and frustrated that you removed the original Group Session feature. It was one of the most useful and enjoyable aspects of the app, allowing real-time shared listening and control from different phones. The new "Jam" feature is not an improvement‚Äîit's a downgrade. You've taken away a simple, fun way to connect with friends through music, and it feels like you're ignoring what your users actually want. Please bring back the original feature. This change seriously affects my experience, and I'm considering alternatives because of it.

author: Ssophos
title: Spotify is getting worse every year
content:
Spotify used to be a great app for free music, with the occasional ad. Now, everything is premium and reeks of corporate greed.

Everything is soulless and is "powered" by AI. Playlists full of AI generated music gets recommended and shoved into your face 24/7 by Spotify, which is so ridiculous because instead of actually talented HUMAN artists receiving money, Spotify gets to keep everything and force you to listen to trash and repetitive regurgitated AI slop that they call "music". 

Instead of writing their own genres for Spotify wrapped (what used to be a fun and original Christmas special showcasing everything you've listened to throughout the year), they just generated random prompts and took all of the soul out of it.

As a premium user, Spotify isn't even good if you pay them. It's the same trash that I just mentioned, minus the excessive ads and being able to download songs.

Spotify, bring back the soul. Make your app creative and fun again.

author: Bhuti Pat
title: Good app but not enough for a market leader
content:
Have been using Spotify for a very long time now. 
It's overall a good app however there is two things that really haven't gotten much better, or even worse, over time. One is that the music recommendations and "radios" are basically always playing the same songs and bands - rarely that something new comes up. Quite boring.
The second thing is, and that really really goes on my nerves, that whether on my phone or on my laptop the app just is unable to play very often. It just hangs and I need to restart it. It's like there is no internet - but there is. This happens multiple times a week and it's an absolute joke.

author: The Seacow
title: Dumb Shuffle
content:
The smart shuffle feature can be a great way to find new songs but functions strangely by playing a predetermined selection of songs depending on which song you start with in your playlist. So it doesn't actually shuffle randomly. It also seems to only shuffle from certain sections depending on where you start it in a playlist if you have a lot of songs in the playlist like your Liked Songs playlist. 

Sponsored recommendations are awful and borderline paid for ads from artists trying to get noticed. Regardless of your tastes or genres they will get pushed in your face based on your country and will not be to your tastes at all. I get better artist recommendations on Spotify in Instagram ads which is a joke. 

The AI DJ is‚Ä¶yeah. Just no. There is no intelligence there at all. Just lazily pushing genres and top artists based on your location again instead of finding you new music based on your actual tastes and listening history. Gave up trying to train it and repeatedly hiding the same artists and songs I don't like. 

Daily mixes have become incredibly lazy to the point where even when you "hide" a song in the playlist it will refresh with the same song still hidden 2 days later with all the same artists in the same order. Also, downloaded songs and albums that are classified as "liked" songs even though they don't appear in your "liked songs" playlist is confusing and stupid.

author: Trea on the beat
title: User friendly, flexible and convenient
content: Easy to use, very user friendly music app. I love how efficient and flexible Spotify is creating your own playlists according to how you want them to be. Searching for music is a breeze. I also love the recommended playlists and mixes. The offline mode in premium mode is so handy. Just one thing though: I wish the app allows for the option to selectively download a single track without having to download the whole album in premium offline mode. Other than that I'm please overall. It's lit. Try it. Don't just settle for free mode, go straight to premium and enjoy all the peaks. Why have a bite or snack when you can have the whole meal?

author: GrumpyGrouper
title: I just wish it would work properly.
content:
Honestly, for what it tries (or tried) to do, Spotify is great. I've had some great artists recommended to me by the algorithms, and the aesthetic of the app is fantastic. The true shame lies in the fact that the app's core functionality as an audio streaming platform is becoming increasingly sidelined with each update. I have been having more issues (freezes, song skipping, song fast-forwarding, audio artefacts, difficulty pairing to Bluetooth) seemingly with every update. These are issues that are not exclusive to me and my device, for everyone that I know who uses Spotify has reported the same issues independently.  
It's just a pity to see, what was once my favourite app, be systematically butchered. I don't care about your stupid "Spotify wrapped", I just want the app to work consistently, that's all.
Oh yes, and added a star because the "Jam" feature is pretty cool. 

Thank you for not caring about my review.

title: Help

Usually I wouldn't let me play a certain song from my playlist and wouldn't show me the list at all. On some of my other devices, the app works incredibly well. There problems. I searched it up on google and google said it was because I didn't have Spotify premium. In that case, my other device is working like Spotify premium without me paying! This has happened to me many times in the past and I'm very confused why this is happening!

author: Œ±Frankie
title: Overall positive with minor flaws
content:
Overall a very solid app. Although I am subscribed to the premium plan, there's still a few drawbacks that I want to mention:

User Interface can be improved. The home page is counter intuitive, and there should be a separate section for pinned playlists instead of it automatically displaying recently played items. There should also be a separate "discover" page to display the random recommended content instead of stuffing all of it on the home page.

author: Jordan_ lika_boss
title: Spotify crashing
content:
I can probably listen to 5-10 songs in a row if I'm lucky before my app will crash (very awesome feature when you're on a run/exercising!) 

Have tried hard restarting, deleting and reinstalling app, logging out, different settings etc. nothing will fix it. 

 I have been a paid subscriber for many many years now, reaching over 2500 songs in my library and playlists alone. I have recently moved over to Apple Music and probably won't resubscribe again to Spotify unless the issue can be fixed. 

The service itself (being able to listen to songs and podcasts/books) can't be flawed. But the crashing makes it impossible to enjoy.

author: andre 898
title: It's good, but there are better alternatives
content:
While the design and features are impressive, I'm disappointed by two major drawbacks. Firstly, the audio quality feels outdated, especially considering it's 2024 and the platform still only supports MP3. Secondly, the company's apparent lack of support for artists is concerning.

Competitors like Tidal have similar features, but with CD and higher audio quality and also pay artists fairly.
